markdownRemark.html:
1. Create a GitHub repo called sudara999.github.io

  2. Copy the template project:

    gatsby new sudaradev [https://github.com/surudhb/gatsby-personal-site-template](https://github.com/surudhb/gatsby-personal-site-template)

  3. Set up the remote repo to track your local repo

  4. Change the details in the gatsby-config.js file.

  5. Create an npm script to deploy the website. When the script is executed, the website is built and the resulting build-files are pushed into a branch named gh-pages on the remote repo. Edit the package.json file as follows:

    {
...
"scripts": {
"build": "gatsby build",
"develop": "gatsby develop",
"deploy": "gatsby build && gh-pages -d public",
...
}

  6. Change the settings in the GitHub repo to serve the website from the gh-pages branch.

  7. If you bought a domain, set the domain to redirect to the GitHub pages URL. I would recommend using a CNAME host record so that the URL displayed in the browser would not change. When using the CNAME host record for a domain, set the custom domain field in the GitHub settings for the repo accordingly.

  8. Run the deploy script!

    npm run deploy

    Your website should be published now.
